interestingFacts: Earth is the only known planet to support life, has 70% of its surface covered in water, and orbits the Sun at an average distance of 93 million miles.
Japan has more than 6,800 islands and vending machines selling everything from ramen to umbrellas.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world, stretching over 202,000 kilometers.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world’s oxygen.
India is the world’s largest democracy and birthplace of four major world religions.
Russia spans 11 time zones and is the largest country in the world by land area.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than people and has pink lakes due to algae and salt.
Egypt is home to the only remaining ancient wonder of the world — the Great Pyramid of Giza.
Norway is known for its stunning fjords and ranks consistently high on global happiness and equality indexes.
China built the Great Wall, which is over 21,000 kilometers long and visible from space.
Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage sites than any other country in the world.
